Tooltip

Use a tooltip to provide descriptive information about the function of a button, label or other element. When a user hovers over an element or selects it, the tooltip appears to provide extra information.

Installation 

                  
                    npm i @govflanders/vl-ui-tooltip

or 

                  
                    yarn add @govflanders/vl-ui-tooltip

Usage

Import SASS 

                  
                  @import "vl-ui-tooltip/src/scss/tooltip";

Make sure your sass --include-path includes node_modules/@govflanders/.

Import JS

                  
                  import { Tooltip } from '@govflanders/vl-ui-tooltip';

Add the necessary .js-vl-tooltip class on the element for which you want to show a tooltip. Add the content for the tooltip to the data-vl-tooltip-content attribute. Configure the position of the tooltip in the data-vl-tooltip-placement attribute. The positions to choose from are: top, right, bottom and left.

      
      
      <button class="vl-button"
        data-vl-tooltip
        data-vl-tooltip-content="This is tooltip on the top"
        data-vl-tooltip-placement="top">
          top
        </button>
      <button class="vl-button"
        data-vl-tooltip
        data-vl-tooltip-content="This is tooltip on the right"
        data-vl-tooltip-placement="right">
          right
        </button>
      <button class="vl-button"
        data-vl-tooltip
        data-vl-tooltip-content="This is tooltip on the bottom"
        data-vl-tooltip-placement="bottom">
          bottom
        </button>
      <button class="vl-button"
        data-vl-tooltip
        data-vl-tooltip-content="This is tooltip on the left"
        data-vl-tooltip-placement="left">
          left
        </button>

The more text you add to the data-vl-tooltip-content attribute, the smaller the font size and the spacing for the text.

      
      
    <button class="vl-button"
      data-vl-tooltip
      data-vl-tooltip-content="For a large button, label or other element with more text, the content is shown in a smaller, more condensed way."
      data-vl-tooltip-placement="left">
      more content
    </button>

Add the --static modifier to the vl-tooltip element to add a tooltip that is always visible. The position and content of a static tooltip are defined differently than for a normal tooltip. Instead of using the data-vl-tooltip- attribute, add the content directly to the .vl-tooltip__inner attribute. Then define the position in the x-placement attribute on the .vl-tooltip element.

Static Tooltip 
      
      
  <section>
  <div class="vl-tooltip vl-tooltip--static" x-placement="top">
    <div class="vl-tooltip__inner">
      Static Tooltip
    </div>
    <div class="vl-tooltip__arrow"></div>
  </div>
  </section>

Accessibility

Don't put essential information in tooltips. The user is not always aware of their presence until hovering over or focusing on an element with a tooltip. Take into account that tooltips don't work with touch on mobile devices. Use standard text labels or annotations, which are more accessible and user friendly.
